Boggw9Ou9NCMkXefIkhpjg.text: Gaucho was overall an eh experience. The ambiance at the restaurant was nice, but their food was just mediocre. I had already eaten, so I ordered their ceviche/tiraditos sampler with the squid ceviche and the king scallop and tuna tiraditos. Each of these was literally one bite. The king scallop was not bad, but I definitely thought the squid and tuna dishes were lacking in flavor. I also had a bite of my boyfriend's steak and it was just okay. Seems like something that could easily be made at home.

9kwfIO-fs8stHPykxSscgA.text: Awesome, that sums up our evening. We made a reservation for 8 (make sure to make a reservation as Gaucho fills up quickly. We arrived a few minutes early, so we grabbed a drink at the downstairs bar. I asked for a dirty martini, they made it straight up, once notified they replaced it instantly. On to the meal.. This had to have been the best steak I have ever had.. EVER. Our waitress was attentive, walked us through all the different cuts, sides, sauces, wines. If you are in London, looking to have a great dinner in a trendy restaurant... Gaucho is for you

pUBcrUXyAy_BorcZj_gIeA.text: If you like steak you can't go wrong with this place.  It is conveniently located right next to the Piccadilly tube stop.  The decor is wonderful and unique.  There is a cow print splashed throughout the restaurant. The door staff greeted us as soon as we walked in and wished us a great meal.  The welcome desk was also friendly offering to take our coat and bags into the cloak room.  It was a great way to start the evening.  We already had heard of this wonderful restaurant from our flat mate and we were excited to try it. We looked at the wine list and they were out of the Sauvignon Blanc that we wanted and the waiter kindly suggested another wine on the same level.  It was a mixture of 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Riesling.  I was very impressed by his recommendation that had a very smooth finish. We also ordered a empanada which was fantastic.  I definitely suggest these as a starter.   I then ordered the 300g sirloin with a side of potato puree.  It was to die for.  I definitely recommend making sure you get a side as all the steaks are a la cart.  The server was very attentive for the amount of people that he had in his section.  He even brought out cuts of the meat to show to us so we could get an idea of what we were ordering. He was also very easy on the eyes which was of course a plus.  This place is a little pricey (about 16.95-22.92 pounds for a 8 ounce steak) but you definitely will not be disappointed.  This place makes for a great date night or a night out with the girls.

C6CilN-zxx1WZxtmknNnRQ.text: What can I possibly say about this Gaucho Grill that hasn't already been said about the rest. If you love meat go, if you're a veggie you'd better stay out. It would be like Dracula going to church. From the still blood dripping steaks you get to the cow hide seats you sit on, this place ain't for those of you who get excited about a bean burger. For the rest of us, this place is like meat heaven. The steaks are just divine and there is such a wide choice. From steak to steak to even steak!! Yes, this place has everything. OK, they do have some other items on the menu, but please, if you don't want steak go somewhere else. I love this place and can't recommend it highly enough. Hhmm, getting hungry now.

mKDJfXf6SMPKhkAMw4buvw.text: In my quest to quickly unlock my richly deserved steak-fiend badge, I am wracking my brain to think of other places I've eaten this delicious stuff. Gaucho is a fine example of a restaurant where you should always get somebody to pay. Fortunately, my dear friend "chief_patto" (look him up on here) was at hand with the corporate card, and we ran up a bit more of that famous Japanese budget deficit. I don't need to repeat anything that anyone has said about the food here, it's excellent. I did find the place a bit dark, since I wasn't on a date, but it's a fine experience non-the-less.

kxGikCzqE3vhlBtZ1kOxXQ.text: The meat they served was nice. It was not relaxing atmosphere, more likely stylish decor. Compare to El Gaucho in SW7, their cooking was less greasy and less quantity. I give three stars because I paid 40 pounds though I did not get unique impression which is worth 40 pounds.

1WXxC64s-RR_4qqM_jX-uQ.text: Great all around, mouthwatering steaks [south american beef].Away from the rumble jumble of shops, shoppers and magicians, beautiful decor, a first floor bar with innovating cocktails is a mood transformer before getting up to the 2nd floor to eat.The raw steak presentation on a cutting board for deciding purposes only, lol, gr8 feature.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom

jRSNKW9zwpyHRSSjTEsFnw.text: If you're a vigan or a vegetarian, then you are out of luck here. This is an Argentinian Steak House. This is from an old trip, but I do remember that this meatfest, in a Bohemian, semi-dark restaurant was sort of interesting.  Marinated Churasco de lomo was was good. I found the chips so so. The service was average , but I did like the cow-hide chairs. Caminando abajo de las escaleras, sin luz, era interesante. El alimento era aceptable, pero no estupendo. Sin embargo, el ambiente era interesante. Overall experience was good.

M9F2NGxXmkuzPXK-_lvrAw.text: Solid place for all things beefy. The entrance is really impressive with a ton of cow fur/hair/whatever you call it adorning the walls and chairs, and everywhere. Meat is cooked in the open in the center of the room to your desired bloodyness and if not, they are more than willing to swap it for a new piece of meat (and new sides, too, if you ordered any). I tried the churrasco cut (spiral cut and marinated with herbs and olive oil) because I like thinner cuts and that was quite good although the smallest for that cut-300g-is way too much for me. Had plenty of my bf's filet and that was done very well, too. Be sure to try the cheesey bread in your bread basket. It's chewy and flavorful. Much like the Korean mochi bread. My only beef (harhar) with this place is that it was too dark. Straining to read the menu and straining to see the real color of my food never goes well in my book. Oh, and they should include SOME sides at least. I feel like everything extra in the UK costs extra. :(

wtJAMAjHKdKBMfmqBO8S1Q.text: This review is based on five dinners here.  It has become a bit of a standard when we visit London.  Good - Attentive staff.  Good transition from your check-in on ground level to the staff that seat you on the levels above.  A great variety of steaks.  They bring representative steaks out on a board as a bit of steak-porn prior to ordering.  I think this actually is very helpful, as not everyone knows the difference between the cuts, especially when making the translation from the Argentinian description on the menu.  Strangely enough, my absolute favourite is the sausage platter appetizer!  Almost worth travelling to London for it.  My wife really loved the empanadas.  I thought they were very good, but for her they were a highlight.  They are very accurate in their cooking of the steaks.  Also, an interesting list of pre-dinner cocktails and an lengthy list of excellent Argentinian wines (with a very necessary translation provided by the staff).  Love the cow decor!Less good - the sides are standard, nothing memorable.  Overall - a chain restaurant, but a very high-end chain restaurant that is able to deliver some excellent steaks backed by solid service.

X3ggSGGrhtHMAF81_v4bxA.text: This place is a total carb-fest.  If you're a meat lover, this is a good place for you.Went there about several years ago and from what i recall...They had a bar lounge area when you first enter and they have the chic cocktail menu and full-bar.  I remember the drinks were a bit pricy for London but they were good, at least.Food - We order lots!  we had a sausage sampler as appt and steaks for entrees.  Food was decent. It's not one of the best steaks I've had but overall, good/ decent.Service - very nice waitstaff and knowelegabeOverall, it's a good place for a large group b/c they have the space and can accommodateDecor: Chic, Hip, TrendyService:  GoodFood:  Good but not greatPrice: Moderate $$$

pVF58MNNtrARvgd0zqoWTA.text: Mmm... Steak.The best steak in London, by far.  You'll pay dearly for the privilege but it's worth it overall.  Great wine list of Argentine malbecs, so wash it all down with a nice bottle of vino.  Then just slowly wait for the inevitable heart attack with a smile on your face and a full stomach.

l-cV8ggyyZ7u4LL1bQMMtw.text: Mmmm, Rib-Eye. (Insert patened Homer Simpson slobbering here.) Yes, it's expensive. Yes, it's the darkest restaurant in London - with the exception of that pitch black one, obviously. But look at that wine list! Look at those rib eyes! Enjoyed a long wine matching evening here recently, which meant a thorough run through all the various cuts of steak. That's why I can now tell you that fillet is lovely and tender but packs no flavour, unlike rump, sirloin and, best of all, rib-eye. Wibble, drool, ad lib to fade Decent chips too, and the humitas - mashed corn and spices - is pretty darn fine too. But let's face it, this is where you go for a bloody protein fix and some big hitting Malbecs and on that basis it never disappoints.

hDpXktiNZyR_xV7E9qD8Yw.text: We walked in here without a reservation after a day of touring around...we were ready to sit and ready for some dinner.  While it did get busy as we were leaving, we didn't have a problem getting a table for dinner...we were there around 6 pm.  The service was fabulous.  We had some appetizers which were delicious and they took great care in explaining all of the different cuts of meat you could get - they brought this huge board to your table for you to see.  I'd suggest this to anyone who wants a yummy meal while traveling in London...if we lived there this is a place we would go to frequently for sure.

MUAMM1B3jDeBOg15sNrw_w.text: By far one of the best sirloins I've ever eaten. Pair that up with amazing Argentine wine, scrumptious dessert and excellent ambiance and customer service and this is a restaurant I'll be visiting again when I come to London.

J1LeJICf75KfsFjTWbMcig.text: Argentinian Steak! Such a nice change from the standard steak.Warning: My husband and I came here last year as well and both times we've had to wait about 15-20 minutes before being seated at our table. Then once you get to your table it takes a while for your server to greet you and by the time you get your food its been a good 45-60 minutes. So don't come here starving.This restaurant is very trendy with dim lighting and cow skins all over the walls and chairs. I ordered the Picada as a starter for the entire table.It was a mix of spanish cured meats (Serrano ham, prosciutto type stuff), westcome cheddar (yum), marinated artichoke hearts olives and peppers. It comes out quick for those who didn't listen to my warning (i.e. me) and you are starting to get dizzy because you're so hungry. For my main course I had the Churrasco cut of the Chorizo (sirloin). It's marinated for at least 24 hours in a Chimichuri sauce. It was very satisfying. They had a special dessert that wasn't on the menu. I got that of course. The bottom layer is a sweet biscuit (cookie), topped with slices of bananas, layered with caramel, then the very top is a cheesecake-like cream. So far I haven't had a bad dessert experience in London yet. The English do it right.anitaeat.com

ykzBiu6hXNUBaimPl9uegQ.text: Certainly the best steak place I know of in London... always cooked to perfection and great thick chunks of meat... only issue is that is quite expensive but worth it for an occassional treat

lSeq8TaHTu-uxE010AIiXw.text: Came here with friends for Birthday dinner.Enjoyed the steak very much, as we can't get any in the States.Decor was interesting.. overall ambiance was a bit too dark and loud for me.Our waitress was very knowledgable and friendly. Our glasses of water and wine were never empty! :)

RYJPq1mKlH7LJdXGLcnQwg.text: Vegetarians - you must not go to this place, or you will go to the dark side. This is my favourite of the Gaucho set of restaurants around London. The food, as at all of the Gauchos, is first class with a fabulous selection of Argentinian steaks with a variety of cuts and the opportunity to see the cuts and have them explained along with how they are best cooked before diving in to the eating. Outside of the steaks are a great selection of sides with the mushrooms being my personal favourite though all of them are great and go very well alongside the main event of the meat. There is a decent wine list as well along with a wide variety of other drinks to satisfy the majority of diners. The wine varies from reasonable to fairly mind crushingly expensive so something for everyone really. The atmosphere is great - its all cow hide seats in a little darkened cellar style setting, and it really is the perfect place or a long lunch that just keeps on goingI seem to remember one time we were still there when the evening sitting was coming in Cheap it is not - but I'd say it's good value as it's not exorbitant. Service is speedy, polite and knowledgeable. Get yourself a steak and enjoy.

Rur1xrrQ5-W0nWLrNSOFDw.text: Been there several times latest one was today. Very good meat quality and if they do get it right in grilling the steak (I am asking for rare) its really nice. Some bad points after all my visits to the place, is that waiters or anyone who's serving has no idea about wines really and they do sell wines there! Very keen to sell but in an obvious way. They are basically working on a shop with no real intention to inform you about their products. Something really nasty is the fact that 3 times I have seen staff cleaning around you EVEN UNDER THE SEAT YOU SIT (!) with a VERY noisy broom Unacceptable-unbelievable. Except the disturbance of the atmosphere its not really hygienic doing that while people dining! Overall, Food: Very good, service: average-bad, wines: good selection though only Argentinean wines, Prices: High.

y-LWsDickj6KTGVHRPHDWQ.text: Not headline worthyWe had reservations for another Restaurant in the area, but due to a water main bursting on Regent Street we had to scramble to get somewhere else close on a Saturday night - Concierge at the Hotel recommended here, and I have a friend who used to work for them - so we went for it.Firstly, not the easiest Restaurant to find and its up a bit of a dodgy alley full of private taxis and bouncers. Once inside we felt a little safer. Ignoring the large group of Italians who were kicking off at the reception desk we spoke to a member of staff who found our reservation and escorted us up to our table. The place was busy, very busy and there a was a good hustle and bustle about the place, it smelled of grilled meat and red wine, two things that turn me on.Service was very in your face, we thought our waiter was South African, but it turned out he was Russian - not very good sense of accent for a guy who used to work in St Petersburg - which was where our waiter was from! Regardless, he didn't do the best job of sensing our preferred service style which was more 'leave us in peace' than 'pull up a seat and talk about the Motherland'.After asking us if we had been before, (answer 'no')He brought over the raw meat board, which was a little patronising seeing as we both work in the same industry and certainly know our Sirloin from out Strip Loin. Anyway, we went straight for big steaks with some nice accompaniments, and a bottle of red wine. Can't remember exactly what the recommendation was from the waiter, but it fell a bit short of the mark. We asked for rich and spicy, but we got big and fruity, not a major let down - but at the prices you are paying you do expect them to be bang on!Steaks were good, and came in good time, cooked to perfection. Part of the experience is watching the grill chef sweat his ass over the 20 odd steaks he has cooking in one go, this guy is truly a master of his grill. We enjoyed listening to our waiter desperately try and get the family at the table next to us to order some whiskies, so much so that I felt compelled to order one myself. A silly move seeing as I live in the home of whisky and can get much better stuff at a fraction of the price form many of my locals - lesson learned.We skipped dessert, and couldn't get an espresso as their water supply was knackered also!! They don't add a service charge, which is why our waiter demonstrated a service style of 'try hard' than 'effortless' but you couldn't faulty his effort. The bill was considerable, but I wouldn't say it wasn't value for money, though I am sure others might disagree, it was overall an enjoyable experience.

9B4EaiGj09RMPTCKADpPIQ.text: Having fond memories of dining at the original Gaucho 12 years ago, my wife and I went back during our latest trip to London. It didn't quite live up to out memories and expectations. It's a well-run place, overall, but too many details were not up to standards this evening. The place was too dark and too cold, one steak was served rare when ordered medium (though in all fairness, the attentive staff quickly responded to our dissatisfaction), the other steak was not quite as tender as one expects at this price, and the fries lacked crunch.

rCll4LBn3MIuL1Ly47iALg.text: As the first restaurant I went to for my first trip to Europe, Gaucho really set the bar for food in London (albeit, Argentinian food).The moment we arrived, we were greeted immediately by the lovely host who took our coats and sat us down. The server was charming, but most importantly, patient as this was my first time having Latin American food! He expertly answered all my annoying questions and showed us what each cut looked like.The food was phenomenal. There are absolutely no words to describe how incredibly juicy and satisfying every single bite of steak was. ---On the table and in muh belly!CHURRASCO DE LOMO - A spiral cut marinated for 48 hours in garlic, and olive oil (400g)OCTOPUS TIRADITO - Fresh tomato passata, black olives, wild rocket leaves and olive oilHUMITAS---1 star was removed only because I wasn't used to how often the server came around. We could barely get a conversation in edge-wise before he could come by and offer an up-sell. The attentiveness was much appreciated - never an empty wine glass! - but it was definitely a little too much. But don't let this -1 star affect your decision to eat there and drop some serious money.

xyZDmkGpHYWSRotV3q34cA.text: Loved everything about this place so much. . .I wanted to take it home with me!  My steak was great, and so was the dessert and sides.  Server was very helpful in recommending wine.  Its pricey and high end, definitely a trendy place . . grandma might not fit in.

GwMUuU7LZsSVQdDWbz0j4w.text: No stars on this one I'm afraid - My partner received homofobic remarks by an employee in the ladys room on her 30th Birthday this year. The champagne offered did not erase her memory of that night. We were informed the lady was from an Agency,  unfortunantly for you she was representing your restaurant/name and we will make a point to share our experience with our friends, relatives etc.  Sad not to come back ever again but then again competition is wide and plenty of restaurants willing to take our money and treat us respectfully. Decor of the place is amazing and flawlessly posh.

8j-cLAYzLbkT55Re5CK23w.text: I went to Gaucho awhile back and the experience was the perfect start to a week in London. Our reservation got lost somehow so we had to wait a little while at the bar but it wasn't a long wait. When we got to our table, the ambience of the room was great. It felt like a nightclub and a restaurant all in one. For dinner I got the rib-eye steak with a side of spinach. It was so juicy and had a lot of flavor. We also got the veuve clicquot which really completed the meal. This place was extremely crowded and I understand why. I would love to go back if I ever get the chance.

EYZ3_f4TOM84sc5fmM40zA.text: This restaurant is amazing! I love the decor! Maybe I don't see enough swanky restaurants in Seattle, but I was in awe by the style of this restaurant - cow fur lined on the walls and chairs/stools, black furniture, dim lighting, and chandeliers. The service was incredible, very friendly, and attentive. All the food we had was amazing as well, I'd give all of it 5 stars! We had tasty aperitifs, empanadas to start, a cut of meat I don't remember, a cheese plate, and bottle of malbec. The meat was so deliciously tender and flavorful, I wish I remembered which one I had. I love when they come out with fresh raw meat to help you decide which cut you want.This restaurant is very trendy. I went after work with my co-workers and wasn't dressed up. I would step it up a notch the next time I dine here (a must when I visit London again!) to fit in with the atmosphere. Love this restaurant!

ZrHiq44rzk178caE71N6mA.text: Wow wow wow! This place is something of a dream! The steak is so good that I wasn't, planning on getting any and when I tried a bite of my friends one I instantly ordered another! The peppercorn sauce which I chose to come with it was nothing short of perfect. I also had the octopus salad! That was pretty good too!

a68vMOmO0wvYruTKhqZvWw.text: This is the second time our business group has been to Gaucho. The first time was great so we decided to come back since we don't travel to the UK much. I've been to many fine dining restaurants in my life but this experience was close to one of the worst. Our server, not sure if the word server does him justice, was arrogant and showed no sense of pride/care serving a group of 4 males. The first, and not the last, glaring issue was we ordered still water and he gave us sparkling water. When we told him of this he only saw our table two more times. We had to go to the bar to get drinks. We had to ask other servers for tasks he should have done. This message could go on and on but I think Gaucho gets the point. The food was fantastic but the service deserves two stars at best.

ZKYxfvs3xxZRC9tJLI8ePg.text: Best steak in town with a great selection of wines. Great staff, ambient and dark atmoshere give this place a full five star on top of a great night out

sDn0J6k1hBZo5SvOH1gmYQ.text: I have never reviewed a restaurant before but felt I had to after my experience at Gaucho! From the moment I arrived I felt special - being greeted at the door by a lovely young, tall guy - being escorted to the front desk to check in and get my coat and bag put away - all included in the service.We were then escorted up the stairs to our table by a lovely hostess. Once we were seated our lovely waiter, Juan, came over to greet us.He gave us menus told us all about the specials - with such passion I was sold! We were a little unsure about what wine to order so he explained in detail the wine menu - he then send a wine specialist over to chat to us! We tasted some lovely wine and ordered a bottle for our meal - we also ordered two mojhitos!  I ordered the starter - a tuna ceviche and it was lovely - fresh and creamy! And went perfectly with the mojhito.We then had our mains - Churrasco steaks!! AMAZING! The most beautiful steak I have ever had - i strongly recommend this cut - its marinated in citrus oils and is lovely an juicy. We had sweet potato chips and lovely humitas on the side.  I had peppercorn sauce too. I don't know what other words to use for this meal but beautiful.Everything about this place was effortless beauty. The service, the food - even the staff! (; I am planning on going again and again!

36b_zxHVi4XeLsKH1zQusQ.text: Based on my experiences of steak houses - Argentinian, Brazilian, and American - the food at Gaucho was mediocre at best. Out of a party of six, only one person's steak was actually cooked to the medium rare state we all requested.  The rest arrived medium well to well done.  When the poor person who got the well done steak sent it back the waiter argued with him.Also we were seated on the top floor which had noise levels equal to a busy nightclub.  It was impossible to speak with anyone at the table except the person next to you.

z6QHDErX64Iy5Q2RvBEXSA.text: Top food and top wine. Never has experiences such nice welcome before. Outstanding service!But very noise, thus only 4*

vYDKXlMCK7P2j9_JINfucg.text: Came here in a work night out with some colleagues from offices in Germany and France and they were very impressed!From the location half way up glamourous Regent Street to the way in, the swishy curtains, the attractive and friendly staff, the HUUGe board of raw meat presenting the choice of steaks as you order, the wine, the ambience and the actual taste of the food!Very good, enjoyable and I hope I am lucky enough to come here again in the future!

0aVwmTdxaCTRvSrHFClWgw.text: Had myself a sense of giddy excitement when we entered here; door staff walking us into reception and wishing us a good evening. Far too many staff flanking an impressive welcome desk with a token stern looking woman on a walkie-talkie. Bags and jackets taken off to the cloakroom. An impressive start. We thought we coming for a steak - not to a hotel!We were lead downstairs by another chap who whizzed off into the darkness whilst we strained our eyes to spot where he had got to. This is not the place for those with sight difficulties. Eat your carrots before entering.The steak and the wine were phenomenal. I really liked that our waitress brought over a huge wooden slab which had all the raw cuts of meat layed out for us to see. We  were briefed on taste, texture and cooking options and helped with our decisions. We settled on a bottle of Malbec to accompany.All in all, a great experience. I'd highly recommend it. I didn't begrudge handing over my card for the sizeable bill.I'd also recommend you get that cheesecake. Wowzers it's good.

unDU5-jPYORsSgDdF4AEyA.text: I am still up walking slightly bow legged after being served up a carnivorous feast at Gaucho yesterday lunchtime. Probably best suited for a client lunch (hence my visit), highlights included being painstakingly shown each meat cut on a wooden board, that would more than make a vegetarian squirm. I went for the fillet cut 'Bife de Lomo' rare - £28 for a 300g slab or £36 for a 400g man-sized chunk. Served with a selection of sides from garlic asparagus to button mushrooms with bacon lardons, I was unable to communicate for 15 minutes whilst chomping away. Lovely service to boot, with a red-lipped waitress offering us an exquisite alternative of dulce de leche as the original cheesecake had been scoffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom

vNyoqb5QdUvFCxwBr8f9Fg.text: I don't know why London gets such a bad rap for their food, I didn't have a bad meal there.  Gaucho is one of the reasons.The decor in this place is absolutely amazing.  I'm not sure if it is different depending on which location you visit; I happened to eat at the one near Piccadilly.  Anyway, the place is covered in cowhide, which sounds weird, but it was actually pretty fancy. I wanted to take pictures of the place but I knew it would embarrass my classy friend.I had never been to an Argentine steak house where they bring the cuts of meat out for you to choose from, but I must say that it was a good experience.  The waiter was very nice (who isn't in London, though?) and we ended up going with his recommendations: The Bife de Lomo (fillet), bearnaise sauce, potato puree, and spinach with garlic & lemon.  Everything was fantastic!  We topped it off with the chocolate tart for dessert. Yum!  Everything here is a la carte, but a good meal is always worth a throwdown.The entire Gaucho experience was delightful, but it didn't end when we left.  As we exited the front door we started to hail a cab to head out to a pub, but the manager walked over and offered one of Gaucho's personal cabs (a black on black Mercedes Benz).  Needless to say the cab driver LOVED us.  He made a special stop at the petrol station for us to get some gum, blasted our music, drove to a few different pubs looking for the best option, and ended up driving us back to our hotel room when none of the pubs worked out.  All in all, it was over an hour ride, but very entertaining.  We weren't expecting the fifty pound tab ($81) at the end of it, but hey, it was all part of the experience.

EaYbkXQaD5wSpd1xw6XYwA.text: While in town on a business trip I enjoyed a relaxing dinner on a Monday evening in their downstairs bar.  Wait staff was attentive and polite, meal was excellent and priced accordingly. The floor manager did stop by and provided me a complimentary order of vegetables since I did not order any with my steak and potato puree. He stated that it was one of his favorites and It is now one of mine - I highly recommend the Humitas Overall a very good experience. The bar is probably not the best place to eat on a busy night but for a quiet Monday it was comfortable. The granite bar itself is not set up for diners but they have multiple tables to choose from.

COukuC77gE1VAdKi1A9-fg.text: A solid choice for those - like myself - of a carnivorous persuasion, this establishment in the heart of the West End really knows how to serve up steaks.Prices are what you'd expect from the area, and the distinctive cow-skin decor will strike a cord in your memory (albeit it has siblings in both the UK and elsewhere, but don't hold it being part of a small chain against it).

s8gKElP4d0BCHK1jDgBXjQ.text: If you like Steak ... you'll love this place. If you suffer from night blindness you won't! It is very dimly lit. That said, once your eyes adjust it is a cool place to be, fluffy cow hide chairs and space age style formica tables with black walls and silver chandeliers. The food is great, the atmosphere buzzy. Definitely a recommend for an intimite dinner (it's dark and sexy-cool) or groups (it's buzzy and hip). (NOTE the problem with the photos of this place is that they (inevitably) are flash lit which totally distorts the impression ... don't be too guided by the pics)..

oemywou-xzSDt88KGMdkow.text: Had a really good bottle of Malbec.  The table bread was yummy with the chimi churi sauce.  I tried the fliet and it was yummy but I've had slightly better.  I also tried the 1/2 chicken and though it was very yummy - it was too salty. They also made a mean irish coffee so that bumped them up to 4 stars.

ZyPL6SKFs9Zu12JV2ua2rg.text: I had visited the Charlotte Street Restaurant back in March on my Neice's recommendation so when I was back in London with my Daughter where else could I go for a great steak. We booked fairly late afternoon but was no problem as we wanted an early dinner slot 18.30.The staff were very welcoming and took our coats we were on the 2nd floor of the restaurant, and were greeted by the Floor Manager, who introduced himself and welcomed us. Just as we sat down my Neice who had given me the recommendation text to say she was in town and could join us if it was possible,I inquired with the Floor Manager and we were moved instantly to a larger table.Whilst waiting for Gemma we ordered as she knows the menu of by heart.We ordered a bottle of house Malbec as there was over 100 to choose from and this was the easy option and it was really nice.Both she and Sharon had Chorizo sausage served on confit peppers and pickled red onion, I had Empanadas, beef and smoked ham and mozzarella.We all had fillet Medallions the girls had sweet potato, and I had carrot, beetroot and roasted butternut squash. This is were they lost a star from me the sweet potato is now oven baked previously they had been chips and were much tastier, maybe not so healthy but definitely tastier, and we all opted to have Bearnaise sauce.The food was all cooked to perfection and as delicious as I had remembered, the interior is superb so much cow hide and the staff super attentive, my Daughter admitted that the steak was cooked better than she could cook it high praise indeed we will return.

zoH_fMRTyGsFKkRca3SNcg.text: When you go to a restaurant like this one where everything is nice and prices are not cheap, you expect a service that goes in line with it. The service we got was AS AWFUL AS CAN BE.He had no intention of even trying. We were 7 and he got 3 plates wrong in terms of cuts of meat and 5 wrong cooking point. It was just horrible.It is not my first time in Gaucho, been several times before and this is the first and last time I will tolerate such a service in Gaucho. Next time I visit, if service is the same, it will be my last.The upside is the little food the waiter got right, it was good.

H5uYX8o4Y1HBUBTV5ScHIA.text: It was really hard to decide how to rank this place but the time has come.I have previously only been to Gaucho for a drink before finally dining at the Piccadilly  a few weeks ago.I was hosting a friend who although not Argentinian, knows a considerable lot about Argentinian food and wines. So it was a really great expectation and a test to Gaucho in that sense.To start off it appears that Gaucho did not serve the apparently best and known Argentinian wine and they also happened to have ran out of the second best. We chose to start the wine on the patio outside as it was somehow dark and spooky inside but the tables seemed uneven and we had to hold our glasses tight not to spill it all over. The samples of wine were only offered to my friend who happened to be a male and it made me a bit uncomfortable as the staff assumed I was the one invited ( I'd rather not take it as sign of chauvinism-) ;)Having decided to dine, we were taken to the dining area and the nice touch was that the staff could communicate between themselves using electronic equipment which meant they could take care of our table upstairs while being downstairs.Although I absolutely love Victorian buildings in central London and the associated spookiness, the interior of the restaurant looked more like a posh night club or a castle where psychic events take place. If I hadn't been there to have a meal I'd probably be thrilled but the reality was that despite the candles, I could hardly see what was on my plate. I really love to see what I'm eating!!!!!The staff properly presented us with the steak options and food quality-wise, this restaurant delivered proper delicious Argentinian food. I know it would have tasted even better if one could feed one's eyes at the same time though. The darkness was overwhelming. Good for a date but not a dining date. I guess the food has made up for a few flaws but then again we had to wait ages for the bill whilst staff were busy having personal chats with each other. Hence as much as I loved the steak, starters and sides - it's only 3 stars for Gaucho as for this price one should really expect better.

UdslpJ_lIVVxpsD0K2i1rw.text: Been here a few times. The serves good argentine steak. There is also a sample of different cut shown to you before you order the steaks . Recommended to make a reservation as the restaurant can be busy at night

xeofOFlynxCKcDsAG7j6Mw.text: As ever a steak here is fabulous. Our waiter was spot on with his reccomendations on the steak and drinks to accompany it. Picadilly is in a good location off Regent St and is always busy - but we started early so got a table without a reservation  (but with a time limit). I really enjoted the starter (something with cheese that reminded me of fondue) and the cheese rolls as part of the bread was really good too. Bearnaise sauce with the steak and I was one happy lady.I love the interior as who doesn't need more cow hide in their life? The ever attentive service was excellent - but full on at times. That said better having too much attention than too little. We were moved into the bar at the end to finish the wine and enjoyed  the ambience there too. Well done Gaucho!

iIZ2iLPB0pcfjefnGxmKJw.text: I sadly dont get it. Add the outside doorman with the very VIP, dark and secret entrance that in all fairness  resembles a dark alley stripclub rather then a wannabe upscale steakhouse. Moving on. How the hell can you even dare to call yourself a steakhouse with butter knifes for dinner service?! Add that up with a grumpy blond waiter that got even grumpier when we turned down her winelist. All four steaks was good, but just good. Not great. Not mindblowing not out of this world. Sadly, cause when I was told this was an Argentine Steakhouses I was silly enough to get hopes, not even high hopes, but hopes regardless.Heard of Outback? No bouncer. They have this strange modern invention called light, there you can see where you are going. You get steak knifes.Decent steak, moving on, trying something else nextime.

q3-p72RipKlT2ZOit11OYg.text: You can always depend on your meal at Gaucho. Though this wouldn't be my first pick for most date nights, if you want to have a quality meal and throw down some cash for a lovely steak - this is your spot. You will have all the cuts of the meat presented to you with an explanation before you choose and you can decide on the cut and size most suitable to your appetite and budget. I've had the filet the last couple times I've visited and one benefit of a high-end steakhouse is that the meat is always cooked to your liking!Finally, don't skip out on drinks and sidedishes.  I'm a fan of the heirloom tomatoes and almost always get a side of Bearnaise with my steak. Their aperol spritz are massive and a great aperitif.  A fun place to go with colleagues and a larger group to share some of the side plates!

TzK7NSIbbLULcwatENa4EQ.text: Went to the one in Chancery with visiting family members last week. Food was great! Service wasn't the best, took us almost 45 minutes to get our order in. Overall a good experience!

sjpz7LJ_l3zUPmZ8mJJKUQ.text: 3.5 stars.It was late March. My husband, his coworker, and I were wandering around the area, trying to find a good dinner place. Husband's coworker, who lived in London at the time, suggested this place. Even though we didn't have a reservation, the kinda-snooty hosts managed to squeeze us in. They took our coats, put them in their coat check area (fancy), and we headed upstairs.First of all, it was very dark inside. Second, if such a thing as a Vegan Hell existed, this was it. Leather and calf hair everywhere, with an open kitchen grilling all kinds of Argentinian beef. Our server was attentive, and did a good job of explaining the various cuts they offered. We started with beef and chicken empanadas. Husband & I had the burger; coworker had steak. The food was excellent. Loved the empanadas. The burger wasn't the best I ever had, but it was close. We couldn't linger for long, because our table was reserved and our hour was up.So why only the 3.5 stars? The atmosphere. It was definitely more of a date night/formal business meeting type of place, with the prices to match. Even though our meal was on company dime, I still felt like a misplaced, underdressed tourist. (I was told to not worry about it, but I still did. That's just me, though.) If we ever find ourselves in London again, I'd consider going back.... with a reservation.

cNR7yhRuZE3OekAItgE66Q.text: Best steak I've had in a long time. Very memorable meal - and wonderful wine to go along. We had the pomegranate and scallop appetizer - which was nice, light and refreshing. I had the rib-eye - 300 grams and we shared sides of broken potatoes, green beans and sweet potato. Everything was fantastic!

gy3w2IxJsQM88n6wkohS4w.text: While waiting for my reservation, I had drinks and a cigar outside on the terrace. I hate to complain because the server was , an Italian woman who was not dressed for the weather and was obviously freezing, but the service was very slow. It  took 20 minutes for my glass of wine to arrive after ordering. However, the bright side is they knew I was waiting for my reservation inside,  tracked me down , and offered to seat me 45 minutes early. Inside is dark and noisy with interesting decor--lots of zebra stripes. Steak and service were excellent.

MytoeZRz3bSa3Zo7LDkhQA.text: I was torn between 3 and 4 stars. I mean - it is a steak, but it's overpriced and I'm not a fan of the pretentious atmosphere. Maybe it's a mood thing - you have to be on a 'fabulous' night out to enjoy the ambience here.Likes:I like the fact they bring the types of steak to you - for newbies! They don't give you a weird eye if you don't know which cut is which. I like their marinate and I do like the meat. I like the service - attentive and people recommend you things not necessarily based on the fact that these are the most expensive food on the menu. I like 'restaurant/bar lounge' atmosphere, that can turn into a club feeling without the dancing! So far I've tried their carousel cut, rib eye and fillet (all were good), lobster ceviche (small-ish portion and is overpriced - if you want a lobster - go to lobster & burger), majority of their sides - all good, but small if you're not going for chips, and why do you need chips if you're eating a huge steak with the plans for dessert? Sticky toffee pudding and creme brulee were amazing.Dislikes:I don't like the tiny sides. I don't like too much cowskin around (see comment about atmosphere).To sum up - if I'm up  for a steak and a night out which would paint the town red - yes. I'll go to Gaucho.

xlUcepGBO5o47std1qHIbQ.text: Sorry Gaucho but I don't really get it. Shame, I really thought this was a place I would like.On one of my typical dinners with an old work colleague, we decided to try another place in London we hadn't been to before (obviously we are spoilt for choice!). Both of us had been recommended Gaucho, so I made a reservation with no trouble and off we went. Firstly we were eyed up by a bouncer before being let in, which screams overly pretentious for a restaurant to me. But this is off Regent St, so I will forgive this minor detail. The ground floor interior was dark and plush, full of mirrors and reflective surfaces. So in short standard up market decoration, which I don't dislike. However, we then went upstairs. Now Gaucho is an Argentinian steakhouse and we booked fully aware of that. The decoration also continued upstairs, with one small twist... THERE WAS COW HIDE EVERYWHERE.This is obviously what I would call a Marmite choice of decoration - people will either love it or hate it. Can you guess which camp I belonged to?! Dear God, like all variety of animal skin I found it tacky and a bit cheap to be honest. But let's move on...We were seated and our waiter brought round the raw selection of steaks that we could choose from that evening. Now again I understand the concept of this and it was great to get a feel of the size of steak and what marinades etc. went into glazing the meat. But I don't particularly want to see the raw slab of meat before I eat it, in the same way that I wouldn't want to go to one of those fish places that asks you to choose the lobster you want them to kill and cook. I prefer my food dead thanks. The wine list was extensive and expensive - we opted for a cheaper £25 bottle which I would convincingly say we could have found in other restaurants for about £19. Then we ordered the steaks, both choosing rump at £25 each. The steaks both came perfectly cooked - I had mine medium rare and the juices flowed out nicely. We weren't given steak knives, which I get that you shouldn't need if you cook the steak properly. But I picked rump and it was a thick cut, so the knife was just not suitable. The sauces were rich and creamy though - mushroom for my friend and smoked garlic hollandaise for me. We also had some sides and they also worked beautifully, even at £5 each. Crispy chips in beef dripping and beautifully buttered root vegetables - in particular the beet root was mouthwateringly good, I just love colourful food!!After the huge steak we were too hungry for dessert, so naturally we ordered it anyway and regretted it later. Just a selection of truffles with different tastes - caramel, salt, whiskey, chilli and coffee. Nice but not quite a party in the mouth. Overall I came away from this meal full and happy, but substantially lighter in the wallet department; now I'm not a good person to listen to when judging the price of steak because I will constantly think it overpriced, I just don't understand how they justify this cost. But this was definitely overpriced, and with all the cow hide around next time I will be expecting a hoe down.

lkxI0yTM7fl6MlxgpQAtBQ.text: Guess what: OVERTHETOP!!!Nice steak restaurant - but ...- to expensive - snobbish service - average food (steaks)Go there, if your on company expenses!

l0dnTgBRPzOPcGACK5232Q.text: First of all, the food was 4-star.  The quality and selection of steaks are outstanding and as good as any top steakhouse in the world.  It is definitely one of the best steaks I have had in Europe.So why the 3 stars?  The service experience was not good.  And, service can make or break a restaurant.  My son is a chef, so I know a bit about this.  Partly my fault for asking to dine without a reservation.  However, the maître d' indicated he could seat my wife and me for 1 hour and 15 minutes.  I indicated that would be fine provided the wait staff are attentive and are informed about this.  When we were seated, the floor of the restaurant was more than half empty.  There were open tables everywhere.  It took a full 10 minutes to get the waitress over.  This would be fine; however, we had been told our table had a time limit.  Our waitress was not told about the time limit - we had to tell her.  She immediately went into panic mode rushing our ordering.  However, after the order arrived we never saw her again.  We waited for at least 10 minutes after we finished to get any attention.  We ate the meal with no water.  By the time we finished, the restaurant was still more than 50% empty - so why the strange time limit.  We ordered dessert and experienced the same panic mode from the waitress. This is crazy.  We tried another Gaucho in Hampstead with a reservation and had a much better service experience.  Suggest to Gaucho to reconsider time limits as rushing a customer through a meal will result in unnecessary pressure for both the customer and the wait staff.  I can't see this being a good business practice.

JWk_9STMwGmGMwUikSrntQ.text: I think your experience will depend entirely on the location. Gaucho in the heart of London's City was ok, but Piccadilly's is much better! The starters were perfect, I definitely recommend the scallops; at Gauchos they serve some of the best in London. As for the steaks, they are sublime! A wide selection of wines are offered as well as traditional and unusual cocktails. I could take or leave the desserts. Although they were good, I don't think they are as special as the starters and mains. Very attentive service, excellent knowledge of meat and advise which wine will go with your meal. If I had one criticism, it would be the lighting. Perhaps every Gaucho restaurant is dark because it adds to the experience, but I think it could be brighter. I want to see what I am eating. And of course the price! I almost had a heart attack: if you include the wine, (two bottles shared between four people) cocktails and beers before the meal; plus starter, main and dessert x4, it comes to close to five hundred pounds. Er, a nice treat! But is it worth it once a year?! Yes!

g1pGCUul0nz63v1y2ldHFg.text: I haven't been to this Gaucho before but it was certainly up to the usual standard.  Very good location just off Piccadilly Circus with a nice outside area - although when we went they weren't serving food outside.Service was very good throughout and food excellent!

aIf14L7ia5AYAgrkLCE7kQ.text: Dined at Gaucho on Sunday night and I was pleasantly surprised.  My partner is a long-time fan of Goodman...but I have to say this was better than any Goodman meal I have ever had.  (Also, I have never understood what the fuss is about for Goodman, especially when their claim to status is "USDA beef"...which I hate to break it to all of London...that is really nothing good or anything to charge a premium for).Back to Gaucho- they had me at "grass-fed" Argentine beef.  That is worth the price.   The steaks were good cut- I had the filet with chimichurri, ordered medium and it was nearly perfect.  My partner had a different cut cooked to the same temp and his was slightly more rare (which I prefer...but not enough to send back).  It was flavorful, tender and overall beautifully done.  We had 3 sides- all decent, nothing spectacular...but matched well with the steak. Lastly, the service was outstanding (especially for London)...our waiter was attentive, swift, knowledgable and pleasant...and on top of that there was always a manager roaming the floor to fill any gaps and address client requests. (Nicely done!)My only negatives were the lighting in the place is either good or bad depending on what table you get (we had one with a recess light directly above us and it was like eating dinner with a bright flashlight on us the entire time...lights should never be projected directly at tables or where people are seating)....second, it was ridiculously cold in the restaurant..so cold that our food went cold after 5 minutes...which was very disappointing considering we spent over 130.  I would definitely go back again...but  request a table not under direct lighting or vents.

M1-Epte36R0pRiqS7DfqMw.text: What a great experience. I have sampled quiet a few of the buzzing steak houses in London, Hawksmoor, Goodman & Cau included but I was a first timer at Gaucho and to say I was excited was an understatement. As we entered we were greeted by friendly staff. We arrived a bit early so were asked if we would like to have a drink at the bar, which we did. The interior of Gaucho is a cross between and nightclub and secret society meeting place with wood and cow skin walls and dark lighting. As it was a birthday celebration we decided to go all out and ordered starters, mains and dessert with wine. Not exactly cheap but we knew that before we arrived. The Ecuadorian ceviche starter was delicious and a modern twist on a traditional Ecuadorian ceviche which I have had many times before. To help decide on our mains, the waitress brought out the meat board an explained all of their cuts to us. As we wanted to try a few cuts we both ordered the Gaucho tasting plate which includes three of their most popular cuts (chorizo, vacio and entrana fina) as well as various sides. The sommelier recommended their own Gaucho red to compliment our order. I must say that the meat was delicious! Each cut different but beautifully cooked and there was a lot of it. We were totally stuffed by the end but couldn't help feeling sad that the meat was gone. Desserts were good but I don't have the biggest sweet tooth so was still thinking about the steak during dessert. The staff were attentive throughout and the atmosphere inside was lively. All in all, great service, great food, great place.

v6ThXvVT4RPtn7o9J4MNmQ.text: This place receives 5 stars not only because the Steak & Wine were amazing, the staff was so accommodating after I mistakenly gif the times of my reservation wrong by an hour. They made sure to find us a table big enough for our party. We were very thankful for that as most restaurants would not have gone above and beyond like that.We all ordered Steak and very pleased with our food. The meat was tender, juicy and yummy!!! Will for sure be back next time I am in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Steak Anyone?

JB8nO3qu1G0jIGoYNTc0Aw.text: OK, it is good Argentinian steak cooked just how I like it.  That said, I think I have tried slightly better ones.  The Goodman in Mayfair would be slightly better compared to Gaucho but one would not notice the difference.  This just happens to be one of the top place to have steak in London.  I have to say that is probably the only thing that is good here.  Actually, I am wrong.  Come here also for the bread and dip that is served before the meal.  Extremely warm, moist and so good with that dip.  I even asked the wait staff for a second helping.  I have tried their other dishes which were not steak and I would say avoid them if you can as they are not worth the money.  Just go straight for the steak.  I have been to the Piccadilly Circus and the one at the O2.  Both are equally good and their restaurants have the same type of decor and theme.  Dark, black decoration with really cool black or cowhide seat covers.  Bars are equally as chic and glamourous as the dining area.  If it is quiet, have a drink at the bar to impress the partner.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom

bVpdqNbDLUcjN3ICAJ0JWA.text: This was quite possibly the best steak that I have ever had and I am a huge steak lover. The steak is comparable to Goodman's and although a little pricey, you won't be disappointed. When you order, you are shown a selection of cuts and are recommended the best one according to your taste. The steak itself was cooked to perfection with just the right amount of salt. Here is a restaurant you can comfortably order a medium rare without getting something over or under. The side fries were generous and the peppercorn sauce creamy with thick consistency - perfect.Upon entering the building, you'll notice the decor looks more akin to a grand palace. The tables are a bit too small for my liking but enough to eat comfortably without hitting other tables. My only gripe with this restaurant is that the service could and should have been quicker than what it was but that may be because it was busy that day. A word to the wise - try the afternoon and not evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Perfect steak at Gaucho's, Swallow Street Branch (just off Regent Street) cooked Medium Rare to perfection.

efSpQVARQQb-Url2wqlQLg.text: Came here for a group dinner, we had a private room on the 3rd floor (might have been 4th). The set menu had a pretty subpar selection. I had chicken and some empanadas, neither of which were that good. I would avoid this place. Service was decent considering the size of the group, and the kitchen seems well run.

dIl_3SF24k968drZ7fl8ww.text: Random choice of place - a very good find.  will try at least one more time.I was looking for BBQ and mentioned to a friend.  Suggestion came in the form of Argentinian restaurant.  Great choice even if for wrong reasons.Apparently there are multiple Gauchos in London.  The one I went is off Regent street and it's three story building.The decoration is internal.  ie. there are not windows overlooking the street so it creates a very posh and somewhat dimmed environment.  The decoration is on the elegant side.Argentinian food is known for its flavorful meats and Gaucho fully delivers on that.  I had too many options to choose from so I opted for a "sampler" with a sirloin, skirt and a flank.  Usually the latter two are on the chewy side but not at Gaucho.  They were easy to swallow and very very flavorful.  Next time I will probably try only flank!!!  yes there will be a next time.

RbmAPIb42dbEqfvjgWurJQ.text: The atmosphere was beautiful! They bring out the cuts of meat before you decide. The servers were very informative and very friendly. Food was amazing! Highly recommend and I will definitely come back!

s_FrFcIcA7sQFsYDaDAiqg.text: We wandered into Gauchos and ended up discovering a great steakhouse with great service. I had the 300g Fillet and my wife had the 300g Sirloin. The meat was top notch-no frills just great steak. Both of my kids ordered off the kids menu and loved their Burgers. Maybe a bit over priced for the food but not bad for London which is pricey in general. Definitely recommended if your in the mood for some MEAT

jp7bsnd1A7IP2sJOwvyjJA.text: Modern, exclusive and sassy space for our group of forty from Arizona! Bold menu gave us a distinctive taste of Argentina! Plenty of food and wine provided! Spinach empanadas were served cold...would have been better hot! Lomo medallions of beef were delectable and full of flavor! Sweet corn and mozzarella served on a corn husk was sinful! Flat mushrooms in garlic were delish! Abundance of dinner options made for no option but to pass on those amazing desserts... Such a shame!

aP8yfBCn_y7AJxAk7L1A8A.text: Gaucho swallow street, i simply love gaucho, food is always tasty, great atmosphere full of young professionals playing hard and enjoying themselves something that really impressed me every single visit about gaucho (@the O2, the one in mayfair piccadilly branch, london bridge, the one in farringdon the one in charlotte street, and the one in hamptead, so far all that I've been to) THEY do truly understand and master the art of service, you can tell their staff have been well trained. My experience is, you come out with a smile or literally they don't let you go'! haha i know its amazing! either by great food great service or if something is not at your standard, by saying its on the house madam or even better when they say would you like to order something else instead madam omg thats music to my ears, i always leave with a smile and thats why its on my top 10 restaurants in london!

oZc3Zx_4PHzai4ZvbFnwCg.text: Great food with a great atmosphere.  I believe this place is an absolute must for locals and vacationers.  I had multiple business dinners here as well.  The steaks are superb.

hROoAF0iqYpueL98BzDJhw.text: Fast becoming a regular at this restaurant.  From the moment you get there you have the staffs attention.  Can be a little confusing as you enter into the reception area with no visibility of the dining area which is spread over a few floors.The bar area is nice and relaxed with waiter service so no fighting to get to the bar, all very civilised.  The staff are attentive toping up your glass or asking if you wish to order again without you having to wait around or try and get eye contact with a passing waiter.Although you have your time booked for a table, and I am sure they wish for you to stick to this, you don't feel too much pressure to drink up and get to your table.Decor is cow skins all over the place so not the place to be if you are not keen on animals.  Gauchos is definitely a place for the meat eater.  I, however, am not a red meat eater but can generally find a reasonable selection to select from on the menu.Let down was on the deserts which for me and my sweet tooth could be better.  The staff appear very knowledgeable in the selection of meats they display grandly to you and also informative about the wine selection.  All in all I nice evening out even for the non red meat eaters!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom

YXFbsv0Pz0CWD6ZUyP61nw.text: Argentian steak restaurant. Centrally located. Food served till your taste. Had scallops as an appetisers and medium rare 400 grms sirloin as a main course Perfectly cooked. Our party of 6 had nothing to complain and would recommend this place for business dinners. Maybe the ambiance was a bit loud or we were the once causing it..

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Excellent steak. Definitely.

EJZJ1HJu_DMmMl-iv3rweg.text: Came for a treat  on a Staurday afternoon. From the moment you step into the resturant you are made to feel very welcome and treated as though they know you. All the staff are friendly and approachable. The decor reflects the meat focus of the resturant butitcould possibly bea little brighter.It started off very quitely as we were placed up on the 1st floor. The waiting staff are very attentitive and knowledgeable about the steaks on offer. If you go to Gaucho's it is because you like your meat and they have a very good selection. The advice given by the waiting staff is spot on so if you go do listen to them once you have selected your cut of beef.If you aren't a red meat fan then never fear they do have some fish, chicken and pork on the menu!!!This is a pricey resturant but you do get what you pay for. The wines are expensive but the one I had was very nice and complimented my steak very well.  It can be a little noises once it fills up with people but not to a point where you have to shout at each other to have a conversation, unless a group of Spainards sits near you and they are a very load group (but it did not detract from the great lunch I experienced at Gaucho's)All in all I will go back as I enjoyed the experience...and more importantly the food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails - taladro Argentina & cogote
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. A melbec which was lovely

2Jq9NzESQF4CnUOBSqOWlw.text: Took my girlfriend here for our two year anniversary. What a great place! I have been previously about three years ago.We booked online and when we got the establishment we sat in the bar area before going to our table. This is the only part of the trip which was a tad disappointing. When we where sat in the bar area it appeared that some of the staff where having a disagreement over something. This was right in front of us and there where around five members of staff involved!! After this we went and sat upstairs. This is lovely! When seated bathe waiter came to the table with a wooden slab with all the cuts of meat on. My girlfriend isn't a massive steak fan and wanted a steak with not much fat on after speaking to the waiter he advised on what steak to go for. Once we had finished our meal we sat on the "terrace" type thing. This is basically still inside but the roof opens. It had a lovely fireplace and was very romantic. Overall a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Steak
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Outside fire
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Tasting plate

7Lk0JSYaab7jGVaz2myTYA.text: Super. We walked in and were told we had an hour and a half to be done, we appreciated and understood. Our meal was late but they were busy. We took our drinks to the bar and had an amazing experience, just super. The tenderloin was amazing and raw scallops. Holy cow.

fjWS4AfnbzYmdvF3JiR_gw.text: I loved Gaucho's interior and intimate setting. The initial service, however, was pretty bad. The music and general vibe were great. The food was delicious - I had the butternut squash ravioli, which was a bit salty but amazing nonetheless. Overall, I enjoyed my experience.

rAbK3tvb1JEDz1oK1XjqFg.text: Over-priced foodGroup of 5 and cold food x 3Poor excusesUn-professional serviceStaff dis-agreements on the floorBad ending to what had been a great dayWe can cook better at homeIn Ramsey terms "Shut it down"Shame there are no negative stars

9EDz8xvDRVKM-evmYes-sg.text: We loved our dinner at Gaucho!  The service was exceptional and the steak was some of the best we've had (I had the medallions, my husband had the ribeye).  I noted that I was gluten free when confirming which sides were an option for me (most of them thankfully) and our server then brought out some amazing warm GF bread for me.  It was incredible with the chimchurri sauce that was provided.  The atmosphere was very cool, although the lights could have been turned up a bit more.  We would definitely return and highly recommend.

59fVKIix0O6ce4exVXlu7Q.text: This was my second visit to this Gaucho location, and as usual, they did not disappoint.  On my last visit, seated in the dining room on the second floor, our waiter said that we should sit in the third floor dining room because it was "the place to be".  On this visit, I was able to reserve a table up there.  It was indeed very nice.  And as usual, you are escorted to the upstairs dining room by the front of house staff, and when you arrive, the upstairs staff greets you by name.  The coordination at this place is simply amazing.  At the table, we started off with cocktails and when the waiter mistakenly brought my drink with a lemon instead of a lime, and called it to his attention - he removed the drink and brought me new drink - again with the great service.  Our steaks were perfect as usual, as were the frites and the béarnaise sauce.  Here is where they never cease to amaze me with excellent service.  We each had glasses of malbec with dinner and after we paid the check, our server came over with little cards with the name and vintage written on them.  Seriously, it was that awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Bam! Gaucho!

BrZ8C6OtBpWerQcJrJkM_A.text: Great with food allergies. Great steaks and a great list of Malbecs. Would highly recommend if you love steak or enjoy red wine.

nH0O9kbTLQo7Lv-x-cQ8gw.text: My wife and I were in London for the night on our way to the states and looking for a nice meal while in town.  We used Yelp to find this place.  We sat outside and had a great meal.  We started with the empanadas -- one been and one sun dried tomato.  They were OK.  We are used to something a little different at home but no sweat.  They were good, not great.  A bit on the dry side....For our main course, we shared a Churrasco de Chorizo.  Since we were sharing, our server encouraged us to get the 400g.  In hindsight, the 300g would have been fine.  The steak was really awesome.  Very tasty.  We got the tomato salad and thin chips to share as well.  Really outstanding main course....then desert arrived.....We ordered the Dulce de Leche Cheesecake.  Whoa.  you don't need to read anymore, just order this thing if you like dulce de leche or cheesecake at all.  Or order if even in you don't.  :)  I love my dessert and this was one of my all time favorite deserts.  It was simply delicious.Overall, we were very happy with our meal.  Our service was a bit uneven.  It was kind of odd.  We started with one server and after he took our orders, we never saw him again and were taken care of by a nice lady.  But I can't say that I've ever had that happen before without someone actually saying something like, "hey we've had a shift change and this is happening...."  It was no sweat...just a little odd.  Service overall was good, not great.

0REbCTQ5ujK97mPclJEWig.text: I love a good steakhouse more than almost anything and was really let down at Gaucho last night.  Went with several friends and the ability to eat outside on a nice night was a huge plus.  The service was also quick and professional.  Unfortunately, the food let us down.Started with tuna tartare.  It was good but not unique.  The real let down was the spiral cut ribeye.  I ordered the largest one, with Argentinean seasoning, and was so let down.  The meet was tough with grizzle throughout.  In addition, they do not give you true steak knives, on the assumption that the steak is so tender you don't need them, but believe I wish I had one.  Had to struggle to cut the steak and ended up with huge bites as it was just too much work given how tough the steak was.  Particularly appalling as it was ribeye, normally a tender cut.Compared to Hawksmoor, Goodmans or MASH, it was closer to Angus Steakhouse.  So disappointing.

tPNRtjYHQjynlIAHeIICnQ.text: My family and I had such a memorable and fun experience during our first Gaucho experience! The cow hide theme is unique, and the ambiance is vibrant and lively. Our server was super fun, full of energy, and took great care of us. Hands down the best steak I've ever had. It was super tender, and the unique marinating sauce was savory and full of flavors. My sister and I shared the 300 g Churrasco de Chorizo. I love the garlic, parsley, and olive oil marinate. It was kind of on the fatty side, but the meat was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and it was super juicy. The sides were also generous portions. We opted for the spinach and baked cheese cauliflower. We really enjoyed them both! The cream corn risotto was also delicious, it was just missing a little salt, but had the right amount of creaminess to it. The Dulce de Leche Cheesecake is also a must try! I was impressed with how good it was. It is now on my list of top favorite desserts. It is not too sweet, and the sauce and the cheesecake complemented each other. Too bad they don't have a location in the U.S.! If you're a steak lover or just enjoy savory steaks with bold flavors, than you must give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom

f0O4sx8M44MF7kgpXmiv4A.text: The service and food, both are amazing. They show you different cuts of meat and you can pick which one you like.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Amazing Argentinian place tucked away from the busy streets

16VzrL4G3zrMl_KTIksaiw.text: Had a great dinner with family at this lively restaurant!!!  The atmosphere is fun and vibrant. We really let our server pick many of the favorite dishes and stuck to steaks and tasty sauces.  The mashed potatoes were perfect too!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Desserts we're sharing sizes indeed!
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Steak options were perfect!!

KjIMCdSpchjJa2HL1KHh7A.text: The interior is definitely a cool theme. They have the cow hide everywhere which makes for a great ambiance to a steakhouse.I will start out by saying the bread they give at the table is awesome. The chewy bread was my favorite!We started with the sun dried tomato empanada. Wasnt the best i have had but wasnt bad. The tuna tartare with the avocado was fresh and well made. The risotto cake was a little soggy for my liking and was very salty. The olive tapenade helped cut the salt but overall the dish fell a little flat.All the steaks were also very salty for my taste. The sirloin was a little chewy due to the fat content.  The filet mignon was probably the best steak of the bunch. Order that if you come to gaucho.For dessert, The malbec sorbet wasnt a table favorite either. Overall, it is a cool experience due to the ambiance but I would guess there are better steakhouses in london. In my opinion we had a better food experience at Mash.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Bread was awesome
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Filet mignon was the best steak of the bunch
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Chewy steak

U2LgRZ_zBFOl6yJ6O94C1w.text: Went here on a recommendation from a local friend while visiting London. Was an excellent meal. Good atmosphere and excellent food. Drinks were fantastic too. Easy to recommend this place. One of best meals on the trip!!

_BzEbEYfn0p70YpO2FjuYg.text: My girlfriend and I were in London on vacation and wanted to go to a nice dinner while there. We decided to try out an Argentinian Steakhouse. There are quite a few options in London and we ended up choosing Gaucho based on the yelp reviews and close proximity to where we were staying.This place is awesome! It's a classy place to dine out (although you don't have to be dressed up to come here.)The choice of steaks and sides are incredible. If you wanted some tasty, uniquely seasoned/cooked steaks come here! The server we had was great as well.Next time we are back in London we will definitely eat here!a

3GRvE2R9C7a0myqO1_kQzQ.text: I really enjoyed my dinner at Gaucho. Ordering the ribeye medallions (great, but not amazing) left just enough space to stuff myself with my newly found favorite Argentinian steakhouse side dish of "humita" - cheese and corn amongst other ingredients (what's not to love?) I also could not stop eating the cheese bread (pandebono) that came with the meal.

hXww3Ge1voAf2E9g484g1g.text: The steaks are great, very tender and juicy. The Rib-eye and Fillet are great.The starters are a but disappointing as the salami and Jamon are quite low in quality and very dry and tasteless...The Argentinian wine is not my favourite... the Cabernet Sauvignon is just ok... risk a little a bit to order... but with such price, you can have much better Cabernet Sauvignon...Not sure if I will visit again...

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Salami and Jamon are disappointed
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. The Rib-eye is great
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. The wine is just ok...

8W5nGsz0Z3sambfmEEbGAg.text: An expensive but great place to have a super steak in London.  Right off Oxford Circus.  Sit in the archway outside and watch the throngs walk by.

uUT5pmGw3g3_oNUqsOtkOA.text: This was by far one of the best eating experiences I have ever had. The service was great we were seated right away. Our table of 8was served both sparkling and still wanted. Our waiter was sure to explain the specials and the streak(although we are aware) We were given an assortment of bread while we waited paired with herb oil, salt, sea salt and butter. Our orders took a little longer to come, but I'm sure it's because they were made to order. I got the lamb shank pie, a side of chestnut roasted mushrooms and a cafe de leche cocktail. We paid a total of 350. The food was well seasoned and full of flavor! I truly enjoyed myself.. a must go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shank pie
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom

nLFudC1Q9pFBZHnsSAe9LA.text: I was looking for a nice place for dinner with parents who came for the weekend in London. It's definitely a great place for dinner!The decoration is nice, trendy and really original. My mom and I, totally loved it! It looks fancy and casual at the same time. The only negative point about the atmosphere in general : the music was a bit too loud and not really great for talks.The service was good. The waitress who served us was nice, friendly and smiling. She took the time to explain the menu (at the same time I was translating for my parents who can't speak English) and to help us to choose a delicious Argentinian red wine. Then we didn't wait that long to be served.Then, at last but not least: the Food. If you are a meat lover like me, this place is your heaven! You can choose your cut of beef, the marinade style if you want one and how much you want. My mom had the medallions of fillet and my dad and I ordered the chimichurri medalions of rib-eye. We ordered several sides to share (sweet potatoes, fries, mashed potatoes and some mixed salad) Everything was delicious and tasty. The meat was perfectly cooked and tender.I totally recommend this place and I will go again for more delicious meat

HwxQxaic7VIlx0Og3ZIw-Q.text: Good steakhouse. We went for my mother's 50th, it was a great location. The food was more than satisfactory, and the service was divine. As compared to American steakhouses, it leaves you wanting something a little more. One of the best in london however - would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Dessert platter

toNUiumdg7mBxQXJIQZFnw.text: One of my favorite places in London to eat. Came here for a relatively early dinner. The ambiance is wonderful, food delicious and very friendly service.

1_Yq07QF810lB1FqewKUNg.text: One of my favourite places to eat in the West End.The food is obviously made in Gaucho, so you get to eat the amazing cheese bread you get served even before you order anything (I confess I think about this bread for days after I've eaten at Gaucho!).The chicken livers are (not surprisingly) among my fav dishes, but you have a really large range of meat options (some fish as well, notably salmon).Ah! Don't forget to try the chimichurri sauce (green sauce) - absolutely delicious!

tWW4eB5cL5WQKazwCFKQsw.text: A splendid experience. Efficient and delicious. Great hospitality and terrific wine matching.The meat was tender and juicy.Came in at 18:00 and had enough time to get to theatre at time (19:30).

s2w1lmY4MiOKvE0lqnJncw.text: The food was good, but we were somewhat mistreated at the end of our meal. I'm 62 years old and in my entire life of going to restaurants, I've never had a waiter inform my table that we had to leave because someone had reserved our table.Our group was having a great time, and hadn't even got to the point in the meal where dessert was offered, when we were told that we would need to leave.It was offensive, embarrassing, and rude. I've never seen anything like it, and obviously I'll never return to this restaurant again.

kJZybog9xOKBbuOak2-iyg.text: Gaucho is back!  Our group of six had a virtually flawless dinner tonight.  Everyone raved about how perfectly their steaks were cooked - filet, sirloin, ribeye, rump - it didn't matter. Everyone was satisfied.  I personally got the ribeye - the 500g tira de ancho (spiral cut and marinated with olive oil, garlic, and parsley) cooked medium rare.  I was able to slice into it with barely any effort with a dull, serrated butter knife - beef that tender is definitely a mark of superior quality, and perfectly seasoned.Being the last night for business dinner, our group splurged on appetizers including a 5-piece sausage platter (beef, pork, chorizo, etc), empanadas (beef, mozzarella), seared scallops, and a bunch of sides including baked root veggies, fries, asparagus, and French beans.  The free bread they served was also good - lots of shapes and textures but I recommend the flat pita-like ones and the balls (like a light garlic cheese puff bread).As for wine, we got a 2011 Malbec.  Very good red wine that goes with beef.  Yes, they mark it up like 400% compared to the retail price listed on the Wine App, but hey we're in London and the wine was excellent.For dessert (skipping dessert made no sense since I blew away the daily recommended allowance already), I got the sticky toffee with ice cream and kumquats.  Pretty interesting contrast of tart and sweet from the various elements - with some added citrus from orange flavored toffee.  Definitely will recommend Gaucho again, and look forward to returning here to dine again sometime in the future.  Have to recover from my meat coma first

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. sticky toffee with ice cream and kumquats
Photo of Gaucho - London, United Kingdom. Tira de Ancho - spiral cut ribeye marinated in garlic, parsley, and olive oil.  Medium Rare.  Can cut it with a butter knife!

8ADrRoNFoq2nV7ZbF4LVOg.text: Been here gazillion times. It started from being my absolute fav and is not I am just ok with this place.The steak itself is nice, there is nothing to scream about. Their sauces are exceptionally good. Apart from that it's the ambience that scores. They try to replicate the experience of fine dining which I in reality not the case. They should try and improvise on their steaks rather than other stuff since they have good competition when it comes to food especially Argentinian steak.

3L61BR1P6IJP44kallCSTQ.text: This, along with the other, equally impressive, Gaucho restaurants, is one of my favourite London eateries. Yes, it's on the expensive side, but you really do get what you pay for here - melt-in-the-mouth steak; the best burger I have ever tasted; perfect, hand-cut chips; exquisite fish and decadent desserts. I have eaten at most Gauchos and whilst each is a slightly different experience, all have continually impressed me. Dark, atmospheric and sexy, the interiors are opulent and luxuriousand subtly tongue-in-cheek.
