They have a very obvious passion for Argentina (all the wines on the extensive wine list are from there) and all the staff are very knowledgeable about the cultural aspects of the brand. As previous reviewers have suggested, the presentation of the cuts of beef is impressive. The menus have a fantastic long, thin, concertina design and similar attention to detail has been used throughout the experience. If you get a chance to book one of the private dining rooms, then do so - you'll be treated like a celebrity. Gaucho is well suited to an excellent romantic dinner, an impressive business lunch or a dramatic and exciting party with friends or family.

GwKTucI6yAS86GX33rUocg.text: I love love love steak and the steak here is as amazing as you would expect it to be for the price! The decor is a quite heavy and dark, making you feel a bit like you are in an underground gentlemen's club (add to this the fact that most of the diners are City Slickers with booming laughs and expensive suits!) but this didn't change the fact that I had an amazing time. I would definitely go there again.

1OWbafnYFYy4UJvDXVutUA.text: If you're looking for a good restaurant with amazing steak this chain of eateries should be on top of your list. I was blown away from the moment I walk in and so impressed with the decor that I was making plans to return before even trying the food! My wife booked a table for my Birthday here and it felt as if we were checking into a swanky hotel. Once we were seated at our table by the floor manager she explained who would be serving us for the evening and discreetly wished me a Happy Birthday which was such a lovely touch as glasses of sparking wine was placed on our table. The waiter arrived within a few seconds with our menu's and once he found out it was our 1st visit arrived with a selection of the cuts of steak and explained the differences. I would go back to this restaurant but would love to try the newly opened O2

DVt_JXo4OrLs7ny8UD700g.text: I am usually the anti-chain person and the anti-shi-shi type too, but I can easily overcome those two biases when the food is really good.  And Gaucho delivered on the food.  The ceviche sampler ROCKED and the steaks were all divine.  Granted not my crowd and a bit trying too hard on the prentious scale, but we had a great time at a nice table with good wine and good food.

Xk4QAb2tm7CXAvJdXgdHtA.text: Good place to go a) after pay day b) for a special occassion or c) to really really impress someone. The food was delicious, the service was spot on, the wine list was incredible and the decor was a fuse between sexy, kitsch and unexpectedly charming (i.e. cow print chairs and leather). I had the churrasco steak cooked medium and it was like heaven in my mouth. I actually don't normally like steak but this was amazing. We also had a bottle of Malbec, which our waitress recommended, and I seriously thought I could have died of happiness when I tasted it. Hopefully I'll get a raise at work so I can come back some time.

QN8-xt3C77xGhrWR14gUaw.text: Gauch is amazing!!! I've been there multiple time and still can't get enough of it. The interior is out of this world. It is modern yet, fits to the style of cuisine which Gaucho offers. I can only say meat lovers this is something you have got to try. I have been to many steak houses but this one is one that I will never forget. Of course the prices are very high and not many people would give that much money for a meal but I can only say that you are missing out if you haven't been here. It is the best streaks you will find anywhere in London. Every visit I make to London there is always room for Gaucho... and as we speak I am booking my next reservation with family and friends. Just incredible!

PV_BKotNfoLeT4oOtHRnjg.text: I have to point out that Gaucho is a British, not Argentinian, steakhouse chain. It serves Argentinian steak and wine in 'hip' surroundings. And there's no denying that it's popular with a certain crowd. But for a truly authentic Argentinian restaurant in London, go to Buen Ayre on Broadway Market. Or better still, go to Argentina, which is what I plan to do very soon. Although the steak was up to scratch this time, I won't be returning to Gaucho again. Lunch for two without alcohol or service cost £40.00.

Dt5ZxB1-qD4uoAfQrD0LAQ.text: Gaucho Grill, superb service, gave great explanation into each cut of meet that was available during dinner service! Decor is modern, funky yet classy with quite a buzzy atmosphere, drinks are reasonable priced, only complaint was that the food could have been slightly on the warmer side.....

EtO1Y10d5sEdmTlu4FKUNQ.text: Well, well, what do I say, Strawberry Mojito's ! yes, yes, yes !It all began so nicely as I had planned to have a lovely night catching up with friends at Gaucho in Swallow Street (I do get the giggles even typing that). Greeted at the door by a very lovely young man and escorted inside to de-robe (just jacket at that stage) and into the bar I went.  The cocktail list is very tempting, extensive and affordable; everything just tickles your taste buds and makes it hard to choose.  My naughty little eyes went straight for the Mojito selection and I settled on the Strawberry flavour to start. Oh time goes so quickly when you are in a cosy, atmospheric bar with friends. The decor is a variety of mediums and creates such a warm feeling. With low lighting it could eternally be midnight, which is without question a preference as I feel like I am in my 20's again, and obviously look it. After my 4thmojioto (yes 4th!)  I glided upstairs for dinner......less another layer, my jacket.At this stage I so was not really interested in dinner but the waiting staff were so friendly, polite and knowledgeable regarding the menu that I was instantly sold. The menu covers all tastes but if you are looking for good quality steak in London this is a must. The staff present each cut that is on offer and explain where it comes from (well... that's quite obvious) the difference between each cut and the flavour variations. I think it was the way that our waiter said "Rump" that sealed my choice. A little more conversation, a couple of Mojito's (I drink fast) and dinner was served. It was like I was channelling a Hyena as I am not sure if I took a breath whilst eating, the steak was full of flavour, melted in my mouth like, sizzled my taste buds and left me with a definite afterglow. I like to think it was the quality of the meat rather than the quantity of liquid that made it so lovely but even thinking about it now I want to go back, just superb !Unfortunately I had no more room for dessert as I do try to watch my belt notch (who likes a fatty?) but did manage one more Mojito before leaving.All in all I love Gaucho and if they allow me back it could definitely become a regular haunt. The staff are adorable, the decor is impeccable and the food outstanding. If you see a nearly nude little guy in the corner with a Mojito, enjoying himself (in a nice way), come and say hello.

K_TmHdSlwWcnOka2eSVoHw.text: the service was poor, they had me waiting longer than i needed to, burned my food and over charged.. wouldn't recommend this place

EiBSn_qT1K1RUYDuTEn36Q.text: This could definitely be a 4 star restaurant but for two issues. First the pros - the ambiance is very cool. There is a nice trendy bar area downstairs, the decor is smart with cowhide coverings. Sounds odd - but it works! Upstairs we actually were seated next to the chef who grills all the meat. Fun to watch but not necessarily best table in the house. When ordering the server brings you a wooden board with a selection of the cuts they offer. My daughter and I ordered a very large marinated rib eye cut to share and my husband ordered a very large filet. They were prepared well and to our specifics. The first issue wasmour sides were cold. When we were finally able to bring it to our servers attention he made some comment I couldn't understand and never returned. That would be the second issue. It is absolutely acceptable to make mistakes and its a true show of the level of service when the mistake is taken care of quickly and properly. When I was finally able to flag him down to get our check (we had no check back following when I alerted to him to the problem with the sides) he acted surprised when he asked me if we had gotten our replacements for the sides and I answered no. He did remove them from the bill which I appreciated but it was a bit too late. So in summary, the meat was wonderful, the atmosphere cool but poor service.

1NoA0Q3SUACbTKdjrrU7Dw.text: excellent food, everythingpalm heart salad, meats greattried several locations and environment and service was just no fine,no attitudemy only issue was cigarette smoke but since I was last there, I believe all London restaurants are non smoking

F_X41oUp4ZGs1ILr-2fkPw.text: a lot of fun, the dark and heavy interior is very entertaining. i did spot a mouse dart across the floor  but this is london and the restaurant is in a basement. these little darlings need to live somewhere. reasonable steak, a bit on the expensive side and the chairs are a classic case of style over substance. a great night out, all in all.

eMp3I1D_XPPqiuXE2igGfA.text: Another decent London eatery. it's a bit gimmicky but the steak is good and this is probably the only reason to go. I went at lunch and the service was very swish, slightly obsequious and probably slightly too frequent. I love the theatrical presentation of the various cuts of raw meat at the start of the meal and the beef itself was terrific. Slightly cliched trendy decor; trying slightly too hard. Justifies the higher prices. Anyway, go for the steak and you'll be happy.

MmNszAA9jyNfmkmErqndUA.text: fresh beef, nice appetisers and wines. good explanation of meats with real one. reasonable price :)

tcKcXTMjrty3-n1mgO0H1Q.text: You can't fault the food, but you pay for it. I had the fillet and it was incredible - cooked just as I like it, and they don't give you a steak knife because the steak's meant to be so tender it doesn't need one. I love the way they show you the board of meat before they cook it for you, too!!

777zkgggQ2Yc2KvB23Z2CA.text: Very expensive, but worth it! If you want a treat then come here. There are a few of these in London, but the steaks are to die for. My husband isn't a huge fan of steak, but he absolutely loved it here. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful, and the service is very good. We would definitely come back here, but only for special occaisions!

25ObTczvrF5TfPe0cFCq_w.text: It was great food and great wine and a lovely little shop for the wine at a lower cost, but I found the staff in this branch to be quite arrogant and up themselves. They had an air of 'I'm better than you' about them and I didn't feel as though I was valued as a customer....won't be going back there in a hurry

UbXu3ni539M7ZAP4WWJY5Q.text: Just bring me a cow and whatever I can't eat I'll ride home!Being a bit of a steak connoisseur, I took particular pleasure dining out in this establishment. The choice of dishes isn't vast. The price is a touch on the wrong side of reasonable. However the steak is possibly the finest I've tasted. Cooked to perfection (bloody as hell), with a selection of grilled veg and choice of mouth-watering sauces, or for the puritans amongst us, with just a fine dusting of freshly ground black pepper. As I mentioned though, it isn't cheap, so try to make sure someone else (the company!) picks up the bill.

LAcEyuVabNWmOTDlZ1p9fw.text: went here for a friends 30th birthday and was blown away by the food..im a steak lover,but never had it like this before. we were served 3 different types all cooked to perfection, nice and crispy on the outside and soft and very tasty on the inside. the wine was lovley and the whole experience was on the whole very enjoyable. definatly worth a visit.
